metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7251 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An Integer Signedness issue (for a return code) in the res_pjsip_sdp_rtp module in Digium Asterisk versions 15.7.1 and earlier and 16.1.1 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to crash Asterisk via a specially crafted SDP protocol violation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-config - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-modules - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-tests - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.2.1~dfsg-2build2').
